Event.Name: AWOC Bush O Club Championships - Chiltern

HashTableEntry.Value: Map and Start Location to be confirmed

RISK WARNING I understand and acknowledge that the activity I am entering may be of an adventurous nature and possibly in a remote bush setting. I am aware that it is inherently subject to risk. These risks include death, and serious injury or illness due to: - Rough terrain and obstacles; - Over exertion; - Heat, cold or other adverse weather conditions; - Plant and animal life; and - Accidents with vehicles, other competitors or pedestrians. There are also risks that access to medical, evacuation or search services might be slow and of damage to, or loss of, your personal property. I understand that all hazards and dangers associated with these activities cannot be foreseen or may be beyond the control of Bold Horizons and its staff. I understand that the activities arranged by Bold Horizons might require myself/daughter/son/ward/guest to obey instructions and co-operate with its staff. I warrant that myself/daughter/son/ward/guest has an ordinary ability to comprehend instructions given in English.
RISK WAIVER I have read the general risk warning and the specific risk warning for this event. I am aware that orienteering and other activities organized by Bold Horizons are recreational activities that can be dangerous, accept that there is a degree of risk and acknowledge that I participate in this event at my own risk. I release Bold Horizons and its employees and associates involved in organising the event from any responsibility or legal liability associated with my presence at, and participation in, the event. To the extent that the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 applies this release is limited to responsibility and legal liability for death or personal injury and does not apply to significant personal injury caused by reckless conduct by Bold Horizons and all other parties associated with organising the event.
EVENT STATEMENTS - PLEASE BE AWARE OF THE FOLLOWING: There is no health, accident, ambulance, disability or life insurance provided by Bold Horizons. You and any people you are responsible for must all be fit, healthy and in a physical condition appropriate for participation in this event. Any questions or concerns should be raised with Bold Horizons prior to participation. If your or any people you are responsible for suffers injury or illness, Bold Horizons can, at your cost, arrange medical treatment and emergency evacuation services as Bold Horizons deems appropriate for that persons’ safety or well-being. You agree to allow the free use of your entry information and photograph or video for any purpose and in perpetuity and agree that they may also be shared with other parties. Please let us know in advance if there are any concerns in this regard and we will do our best to accommodate special requests. Whilst Bold Horizons will provide the activity we note that any children attending remain in your care and as such must be appropriately supervised at all times. We acknowledge that parents and guardians are responsible for deciding whether their children are capable of orienteering by themselves at each event. Should any SportIdent sticks or cards be lost at the event, an additional fee will be levied as a replacement cost for these items. The fee is $50 for SportIdent sticks and $20 for SportIdent cards.

Location: Davidson High School and Mimosa Public School, enter from Mimosa St, Frenchs Forest
Pre-entry is appreciated for regulars that are registered on Eventor (and have not already purchased a term pass). Pre-entries close at midnight on Thursday 31 October.
Saturday Orienteering Series is open to everyone. No experience is necessary and courses are ideal for anyone wishing to get some exercise and immerse themselves in a mini adventure. Beginners and experienced orienteers are very welcome. Students, mums, dads, uncles, aunts, friends, grandparents: all ages can run or walk and enjoy the SOS.
Registration is from 9am with starts between 9:30am and 11am.
Enter at the event or purchase a discounted term pass from the link on the Bold Horizons web page. Entry costs $10-$12 for members with their own SPORTident stick or $15 for non-members or runners hiring timing sticks. Pay by card or cash (exact money is appreciated).
If groups of more than 5 are attending we would be grateful if you could contact Barbara on 0418 270 476 in advance so that we can be sure to look after you.

Event.Name: Central Coast Beach Series 1 - Terrigal Haven

HashTableEntry.Value: Location: Terrigal Haven Starts from 9:00 to 10:30. Just turn up and enter on the Day. First-timers are most welcome, experienced orienteers will be available to provide instructions. You can run, jog or walk; individually, or in a small group; it's your choice.

Park/Street orienteering event with mass start at 5pm. Registration open from 4:15pm. At A S Luketina Reserve, Buntine Rd, Wembley Downs. Enter on the day, scatter course with three distance options available (2-3 km, 4-6 km, 7-8 km). NEWCOMERS WELCOME!
Get your season pass here! https://eventor.orienteering.asn.au/Events/Show/9276

Club Relays Venue: Picton Botanic Gardens, Regreme Road, Picton. (adjacent to carpark) Team draw at 10:30, mass start at 11:00. Easy line course also available. Free to SHOO members, $5 to others. BYO barbeque or picnic to enjoy afterwards.

Event.Name: Foresters' Forest - Novelty "Come and Try Orienteering" event

HashTableEntry.Value:
This are was mapped in the early 2000s by Tintookies and was planted out with various tree species in blocks. The event today is to bring people to the area to enjoy it, assist to draw attention to it and promote the conservation of the area for its current use. Two fun courses will be offered - One is a short line course ((approx 2km) and the other is a "Tree-O" course (1.5km novelty, tree focused course).
Enter the area from the bend on Anna Meares Drive
Stay and enjoy a guided tour of the area, and share picnic lunch from 12 noon if you wish.

This event is for Primary School aged children and their families.
Our next planned Darts get together will go ahead as planned this coming Saturday (2nd November) at Oaklands Park. Evalin (Our visiting coach) is planning the activity for the day. The area is really a nice one, with the wetlands and park with lovely paths to run or walk on. Parents are very welcome to try the activity as well Please arrive at about 11am to allow for everyone to take part in a fun orienteering activity before eating your BYO picnic lunch while you chat with other families. Turn in to the south off of Oaklands road onto The Parade West (down the side of the wetlands) and then turn west into the car park at the end of the road. Look for us just near the end of the carpark. Please bring • Running shoes • A smile • BYO lunch and drinks • Chairs or blanket Please RSVP to Erica on 0408852313 to let her know if you can come to the activity. This will allow Evalin to plan better. If you can’t make it to this one, then we have another one planned for the 16th of November – we are still trying to lock in the location but it will probably be pretty close to the city. See you there
